title: 90sbb
author: 90sbb
content: I live in NY and can't buy any crypto there are no atms (all shutdown) all exchanges block me the only way I can think is by person but that's kinda risky unless I know them irl. Any suggestions?

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: 90sbb on June 04, 2023, 02:56:33 PMI live in NY and can't buy any crypto there are no atms (all shutdown) all exchanges block me the only way I can think is by person but that's kinda risky unless I know them irl. Any suggestions?You can try exchanges like Gemini, and Coinbase to purchase Bitcoin in New York city. I'm not sure about other crypto-exchanges, but you can at least purchase Bitcoin by using those two exchanges, and I'm sure that falls into category of legal actions. They are available for the residents of the New York city and anyone could purchase crypto-currencies from those exchanges.If you're unable to access those exchanges then you should contact your internet service provider and ask them the reason that why you aren't able t access those exchanges even these two are legally selling crypto-currencies in the city and have proper licenses to work in that particular region.You should also elaborate that what problems are you facing while visiting those exchanges? Once we know your problems then we will try our best to help you. I recommend you to try those exchanges first and if they don't work for you then you should let me and others know so that we could help you as much as we possibly can.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: 90sbb on June 04, 2023, 02:56:33 PMI live in NY and can't buy any crypto there are no atms (all shutdown) all exchanges block me the only way I can think is by person but that's kinda risky unless I know them irl. Any suggestions?I know that the use, buying, and selling of Bitcoin is not illegal in New York so your restrictions might be a personal issue. You didn't state why you have been blocked from accessing or using all the exchanges you tried using. Maybe you might be having a KYC issue with these exchanges and you may have to consult their customer service to determine what is wrong. Have tried using the Bitcoin ATM finder tool to search for functional ATMs in New York, it could also be of good help. But if you care about your privacy you might consider using some reliable P2P platforms like Bisq and others. Or you can consider buying from a reputable member of the forum.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: I don't think it's too hard to write "buy crypto in NY with my_bank_name" in any search engine. Binance.us I think will accept almost all payments by US-based bank account or virtual card. Given the big name, I'm not experienced on that exchange (it's for US residents only). DWYOR

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: 90sbb on June 04, 2023, 02:56:33 PMI live in NY and can't buy any crypto there are no atms (all shutdown) all exchanges block me the only way I can think is by person but that's kinda risky unless I know them irl. Any suggestions?maybe, @SamReomo, already told you the name of the exchange you can use to buy crypto in New York.Or if you want to see clarity, maybe you can look here Buy Crypto & Bitcoin in New York, I think it can be important information for you.Here you can also learn and see How to Buy Bitcoin in New York: Best NY Crypto Exchanges, I hope this helps you with some of the information above.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Quote from: 90sbb on June 04, 2023, 02:56:33 PMI live in NY and can't buy any crypto there are no atms (all shutdown) all exchanges block me the only way I can think is by person but that's kinda risky unless I know them irl. Any suggestions?I am not aware that NY banned crypto transactions. I don't think it is correct unless something has changed in last couple of weeks. Which exchanges are banning you? What is the reason they are providing? I am sure that's not for the location. As per the Bitlicense, any exchanges holding the license, are allowed to offer crypto services to any NY residents. Try Coinbase if you haven't already.

comments.author: zasad@
comments.body: Quote from: 90sbb on June 04, 2023, 02:56:33 PMI live in NY and can't buy any crypto there are no atms (all shutdown) all exchanges block me the only way I can think is by person but that's kinda risky unless I know them irl. Any suggestions?Are Perfect Money USD,PayPal,Skrill,Neteller and others available in your country?Then register, fund your account and try to buy a small amount of cryptocurrency from an exchanger with good reviews, preferably more than a few hundred.https://www.bestchange.com/__These services do not provide documents for the purchase of cryptocurrencies like the Coinbase exchange, so study the tax consequences on your own.

comments.author: Liamgardiner
comments.created_time: August 01, 2023, 11:25:09 AMLast edit: August 02, 2023, 05:33:40 AM by Liamgardiner
comments.body: Hello, Buying crypto in New York can indeed be challenging due to strict regulations known as the BitLicense. Here are a few ways you might be able to buy cryptocurrency:Peer-to-Peer (P2P) Trading: This involves buying from someone directly. You'll need to take precautions to ensure your safety and the security of your funds.Â  MyTHDHR BenefitsOut-of-State Purchase: If you regularly visit another state, you could consider buying cryptocurrency there, if it's legal and more accessible.Use of a Trusted Exchange: Some exchanges like Gemini and Coinbase are allowed to operate in New York and offer a variety of cryptocurrencies.

comments.author: benalexis12
comments.body: Quote from: 90sbb on June 04, 2023, 02:56:33 PMI live in NY and can't buy any crypto there are no atms (all shutdown) all exchanges block me the only way I can think is by person but that's kinda risky unless I know them irl. Any suggestions?what exchange are you referring to that blocked you from buying Bitcoin or cryptocurrency? because what I know that you can buy crypto there in New York is Kucoin, cashapp, gemini and coinbase. It's just surprising because you can't buy bitcoin at the ATMs that I know there are more than 1k plus ATMs in NY. You mean all that is useless?

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: If you happen to visit this thread again, try looking into no-kyc p2p exchanges, see: https://kycnot.me/?cash=onI'd say agoradesk is the most beginner-friendly, robosats is balanced and bisq may not be beginner friendly but has the best privacy and security at the moment.
